DataElement.preferredName: Breast Implant Present Placement Anatomic Site
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Information related to the placement location of a breast implant.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest._A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.:A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue.

Concepts.definition: One of two hemispheric projections of variable size situated in the subcutaneous layer over the pectoralis major muscle on either side of the chest.
A prosthesis placed permanently in tissue.

Property.preferredDefinition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The placement location of a breast implant.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: In anatomy indicating lower than a given reference point.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Muscles of the upper chest. The term may refer to one of two muscles, the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor. The former is a thick muscle in the anterior portion of the chest. Its action involves flexion, medial rotation, and adduction of the humerus. The latter is a thin muscle located beneath the pectoralis major. Its action involves lowering the scapula and raising the ribs.

Concepts.definition: In anatomy indicating lower than a given reference point.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.

Muscles of the upper chest. The term may refer to one of two muscles, the pectoralis major and pectoralis minor. The former is a thick muscle in the anterior portion of the chest. Its action involves flexion, medial rotation, and adduction of the humerus. The latter is a thin muscle located beneath the pectoralis major. Its action involves lowering the scapula and raising the ribs.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A silicone gel-filled or saline-filled sac placed under the chest muscle to restore breast shape.:Position or arrangement, as of the teeth; the state of being placed or arranged, as the assignment of a person to a appropriate clinical study.:Named locations of or within the body.
